state.goal: Analyse the current implementation of sindarin, create different permutations of sindarin programs in the /tmp/ directory, compile and run them to be sure everything it is capable of right now works, do not add any language features merely test to be sure everything works as expected, if you find issues, introduce a failing test to isolate the problem, then make the test pass. If your sinarin does not compile, be sure the syntax is correct before making code changes.

plan.goal: Analyse the current implementation of sindarin, create different permutations of sindarin programs in the /tmp/ directory, compile and run them to be sure everything it is capable of right now works, do not add any language features merely test to be sure everything works as expected, if you find issues, introduce a failing test to isolate the problem, then make the test pass. If your sinarin does not compile, be sure the syntax is correct before making code changes.
plan.analysis: This task requires understanding the Sindarin compiler's current capabilities, creating comprehensive test programs to exercise all features, compiling and running them to verify correctness, and fixing any discovered issues through test-driven development.

steps.description: Read compiler source files (lexer, parser, type_checker, code_gen) and existing samples to understand all supported language features and syntax
Create test programs in /tmp/ covering basic types (int, double, str, char, bool), variable declarations, and assignments
Create test programs for arithmetic/logical operators, comparisons, and string interpolation
Create test programs for control flow (if/else), functions with various parameter/return types, and lambda expressions
Create test programs for arrays, closures, and any other advanced features found in the codebase
Build the compiler using ./scripts/build.sh and verify build succeeds
Compile and run each test program, documenting any failures or unexpected behavior
For each discovered issue, create a minimal failing integration test in compiler/tests/integration/
Debug and fix failing tests, ensuring the fix doesn't break existing functionality
Run full test suite (./scripts/test.sh and ./scripts/integration_test.sh) to verify all tests pass

plan.raw:
ANALYSIS: This task requires understanding the Sindarin compiler's current capabilities, creating comprehensive test programs to exercise all features, compiling and running them to verify correctness, and fixing any discovered issues through test-driven development.

PLAN:
1. Read compiler source files (lexer, parser, type_checker, code_gen) and existing samples to understand all supported language features and syntax | complex
2. Create test programs in /tmp/ covering basic types (int, double, str, char, bool), variable declarations, and assignments | simple
3. Create test programs for arithmetic/logical operators, comparisons, and string interpolation | medium
4. Create test programs for control flow (if/else), functions with various parameter/return types, and lambda expressions | medium
5. Create test programs for arrays, closures, and any other advanced features found in the codebase | medium
6. Build the compiler using ./scripts/build.sh and verify build succeeds | simple
7. Compile and run each test program, documenting any failures or unexpected behavior | medium
8. For each discovered issue, create a minimal failing integration test in compiler/tests/integration/ | medium
9. Debug and fix failing tests, ensuring the fix doesn't break existing functionality | complex
10. Run full test suite (./scripts/test.sh and ./scripts/integration_test.sh) to verify all tests pass | simple

TOTAL_STEPS: 10
